1.0.0.description: Initial release with AI recipe generation, pantry management, and multi-user home administration

2.0.0.description: General overhaul with new UI, improved AI integration, and enhanced recipe customization

2.1.0.description: Update color themes with Claude.ai-inspired dark theme, remove desktop top bar and move theme switcher to left nav, create intelligent version system with contextual bump analysis and UI integration

2.3.2.description: Major inventory system refactor: Replace daysUntilExpiry with expiresAt timestamps, add date pickers to forms, implement backward compatibility, and fix syntax errors

2.3.3.description: Fix critical date handling bugs: Fix Firestore timestamp processing for expiresAt fields, prevent EditItemModal crashes from invalid dates, replace NaN displays with proper error handling, and add comprehensive date validation utilities

2.3.4.description: Fix display rendering issue where items with daysUntilExpiry but no expiresAt were showing 'No expiry date' in cards while EditItemModal displayed correct dates. Updated getExpiryInfo and getExpiryStatus functions to properly handle backward compatibility fallbacks.

2.3.5.description: Add comprehensive meal planner feature with mobile-first design, recipe scheduling, manual meal logging, pantry integration, and Schedule Recipe button in recipe generator

2.3.6.description: Add major new meal planner feature with calendar view, recipe scheduling, manual meal logging, pantry integration, new API endpoints, mobile-first design, and comprehensive meal planning functionality

2.4.0.description: Add comprehensive meal planner feature: new planner page with calendar view, recipe scheduling system, manual meal logging, pantry integration, new API endpoints, and Schedule Recipe button in recipe generator

2.5.0.description: Improve version manager to better detect feature additions and comprehensive features for more accurate semantic versioning

2.6.0.description: Fix RecipeSelector authentication and UI issues: standardize getAuthHeaders usage, fix recipe name display, and improve search box icon alignment

2.6.1.description: Refactor version management to use single source of truth: consolidate to root version.json, update backend endpoints to read from unified location, and establish automated version management protocol

2.7.0.description: Critical planner fixes and major UX improvements: Fix timezone bug causing meals to save to wrong dates, improve mobile responsive design with proper 'Today' indicator, enhance meal slot information display with better space utilization, improve color contrast for completed meals, remove unnecessary notes field from meal modal, and implement progressive disclosure pattern for desktop vs mobile interactions

2.7.1.description: Critical mockup alignment fixes: Fix desktop grid layout to split 7 days across 2 rows for better space utilization, revert meal entries to single-line layout matching original mockup, remove status text not present in mockup design, fix empty states to show only meal type names, and reduce vertical spacing to match mockup density

2.7.2.description: Unified Modal System Implementation: Create intelligent UnifiedMealModal with state-based UI adaptation, fix critical timezone bugs with date-only system, simplify meal state logic, remove checkmark from completed meals, replace dual-modal complexity with single adaptive interface, implement quick-complete functionality, and streamline user experience with click-to-edit interactions

2.7.3.description: Critical Timezone Bug Resolution: Comprehensive fix for meals saving to wrong days by implementing date-only system, eliminating all UTC conversions in API calls, replacing timestamp usage with date strings, fixing unsafe date display logic, and ensuring timezone-independent meal storage. Verified with 100% passing logic test across all timezones.

2.8.0.description: Comprehensive 3-State Meal System Implementation: Complete overhaul of meal state management with unified empty→planned→completed system, recipe name prioritization across all components, simplified modal modes with dedicated completion workflow, full recipe picker integration in all meal contexts, eliminated redundant state functions, and restored proper visual feedback. Resolves all Phase 5 regressions while maintaining timezone fixes.

2.9.0.description: Complete-First Modal System: Revolutionary UX transformation from edit-first to completion-first interaction pattern for planned meals, multi-stage completion workflow (completion intent → custom meal entry), integrated recipe selector in completion flow, enhanced quick complete functionality with proper completion data structure, comprehensive Phase 1 implementation of three-state meal planner target system, and full end-to-end testing verification.

2.9.1.description: Fix button consistency: Standardize all action button sizes to w-8 h-8 (desktop) and w-9 h-9 (mobile) with w-4 h-4 icons. Updated + button from w-7 h-7 to match checkmark and three-dot button dimensions for perfect visual alignment.

2.10.0.description: Production-ready improvements: Environment-based logging system, CSS design system with custom properties and utility classes, React performance optimizations with memoization, console.log cleanup for production builds, and enhanced developer experience with structured debugging.

2.11.0.description: Add JSON Export Feature: New pantry data export functionality with comprehensive JSON structure generation, copy-to-clipboard integration, modal-based user interface, and complete metadata including item details, timestamps, and export source identification.

2.11.1.description: Code quality improvements from PR#18 review: Remove unnecessary loading state from JSON export modal, fix useEffect dependency issue with handleClose callback, and simplify redundant ternary condition in PantryToolbar styling.

2.11.2.description: Critical bug fix: Wrap handleClose in useCallback to prevent infinite re-renders in JSONExportModal React Hook Dependencies issue. Improves performance and prevents potential memory leaks.

2.12.0.description: GCP App Engine Deployment with Runtime Secret Management: Implement secure production deployment on Google Cloud Platform with Secret Manager integration, runtime secret fetching for backend (eliminates secrets in config files), Cloud Build automation with build-time secret injection for frontend, comprehensive deployment scripts and documentation, auto-scaling to zero for free tier optimization, and full local development compatibility.

2.12.1.description: Critical security fixes: Fix authorization check logic bug that could allow unauthorized access to pantry endpoints (removed incorrect negation operator), tighten CORS configuration to whitelist only specific origins instead of allowing any subdomain (prevents malicious sites from making authenticated requests), and remove hardcoded project ID from cloudbuild.yaml for portability. All fixes include dynamic project ID resolution for maintainability.

2.12.2.description: Fix GCP environment detection in dev service: Remove NODE_ENV requirement from isGCP() check to properly detect App Engine dev service (NODE_ENV=development). This fixes 503 errors where backend was incorrectly trying to load from .env file instead of Secret Manager on GCP dev deployments.

2.13.0.description: Automated version management system: Single-command version updates with bump-version.js and get-version.js scripts, automatic synchronization across all package.json files, updated version management protocol, and new documentation protocol with clear scope definitions and DRY guidelines

2.14.0.description: Cloud Build performance optimization: Refactor dependency caching from rsync to tar+gzip compression (85% size reduction), implement parallel cache transfers with multi-threaded downloads/uploads, switch from npm ci to npm install for cache utilization, reduce build time by ~1 minute, and dramatically improve log readability (65,000+ lines to ~20 lines)

2.14.1.description: Update deployment documentation with accurate tar+gzip caching details, improve .gcloudignore with source map exclusions, and update app-dev.yaml template placeholders

2.14.2.description: Fix PR review issues: sync lastUpdated field in bump-version.js, optimize Cloud Build parallelization by removing unnecessary install-root dependencies for ~5 second build improvement, and fix app-dev.yaml placeholder inconsistencies

2.14.3.description: Remove --production flag from npm install commands to properly leverage cached dependencies including devDependencies

2.15.0.description: Add GitHub Actions CI/CD workflows for automated deployments to dev and production environments

2.15.1.description: Configure ESLint and resolve lint errors for PR validation

2.15.2.description: GitHub Actions workflow improvements: Use optimized Cloud Build pipeline with tar+gzip caching and E2_HIGHCPU_8 for faster deployments, disable redundant ESLint in build step (linting handled by dedicated validation step)

2.15.3.description: Fix deployment URL display in GitHub Actions summaries (was showing *** due to secret redaction)

2.15.4.description: Automate develop sync after production releases, skip redundant dev deployments, and document CI/CD workflow

2.15.5.description: Fix sync-develop workflow to bypass branch protection using PAT

2.15.6.description: Configure Cloud Build to use E2_STANDARD_2 free tier machine type, add Development Workflow Protocol to CLAUDE.md with mandatory GitFlow branching model

2.15.7.description: Remove unreliable Cloud Build caching mechanism that was failing due to race condition, simplify build configuration from 7 to 5 steps, and improve build reliability

2.15.8.description: Implement comprehensive logging improvements: Pino for backend with structured JSON logging, custom lightweight logger for frontend, clean one-line HTTP logs, business context logging across all features (40+ log statements), sensitive data redaction, userId/homeId preserved for debugging

2.16.0.description: Add Smart Shopping List feature: AI-powered item parsing with natural language support, auto-categorization into 6 grocery categories (produce, dairy, meat, pantry, frozen, other), inline editing for all item fields, check/uncheck functionality with visual feedback, collapsible category sections, clear checked items button, mobile-responsive design with beautiful animations, new Firestore collection for shopping_lists scoped by homeId, 6 RESTful API endpoints, custom useShoppingList hook, and full integration with existing navigation and authentication system

2.16.1.description: Fix shopping list API endpoints to follow existing patterns: Change endpoints to accept homeId as route parameter instead of fetching from database, update frontend hook to pass activeHomeId from context, resolves 'No home associated with user' error

2.16.2.description: UI improvements: replaced checkbox with green check icon, standardized fonts, updated header pattern, fixed spacing to match pantry

2.17.0.description: Pantry UX improvements: make list view default, add click-to-edit rows, replace three-dot menu with hover-based delete button (shopping list pattern), mobile-optimized with always-visible actions

2.18.0.description: Added search, filters, grouping, and metadata display to shopping list: search by item name, filter by category/status/user/date, group by category/date/user/status/none, metadata shows time and user (conditional on multi-user homes), responsive padding, fixed layout wrapping issues

2.19.0.description: Comprehensive Manage page: Replaced Admin page with organized Manage interface featuring user profile editing (name), home management (name/members) for admins, and Settings section with theme toggle. Added backend PUT endpoints for user/home updates with proper authentication, fixed profile refresh bug causing unexpected logouts, improved responsive sidebar visibility (768-1024px breakpoint alignment), and enhanced UX with inline editing and proper permissions enforcement.

2.20.0.description: Enhanced navigation UX with emoji icons and added Planner/Shopping cards to HomePage for improved feature discoverability

2.21.0.description: Convert shopping list to modal-based editing with pantry-matching design

2.22.0.description: Add rate limiting for AI endpoints: per-user rate limiter (100 requests/hour) protects 5 AI endpoints from abuse, express-rate-limit middleware with Firebase UID tracking, helpful error messages on limit exceeded, comprehensive test script for verification, and full documentation in CLAUDE.md

2.23.0.description: CSS consolidation Phase 1: Create 440+ lines of shared component classes (list items, modals, alerts, badges, empty states, categories, toolbars, loading states, input sections), migrate 6 components to use shared styles, reduce Pantry.css by 79% (95→20 lines) and ShoppingList.css by 62% (371→140 lines), improve consistency and maintainability across all pages

2.23.1.description: Refactor AI logic into dedicated service modules: Extract recipe generation, pantry suggestions, quick defaults, and image detection logic from server.js into recipeAI.js and pantryAI.js services. Reduces server.js by 325 lines, improves code organization, testability, and maintainability while maintaining identical functionality.

2.23.2.description: CSS consolidation Phase 2: Add 100+ utility classes (text, border, skeleton, background), migrate 5 modal components (FilterModal, EditItemModal, EditShoppingItemModal, ShoppingListFilterModal, JSONExportModal) to shared modal/alert classes, eliminate 200+ inline styles, replace modal delete buttons with trash icon (grey with red hover), reposition delete icon to footer left with proper spacing, reduce bundle by 100+ bytes

2.23.3.description: Refactor inline styles to CSS utility classes for improved maintainability

2.23.4.description: Continue CSS utilities expansion and inline style refactoring (Phase 3.1-3.3 completion)
